{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which option is not a part of the ethmoid bone, we need to review the information provided in the relevant documents. The ethmoid bone is an unpaired bone located between the eyes that contributes to the medial wall of the orbit, the nasal cavity, and the nasal septum. It consists of several parts, including the cribriform plate, ethmoidal labyrinth, and perpendicular plate. The ethmoid bone also contains ethmoidal sinuses or ethmoidal air cells. We need to identify which option does not correspond to any of these structures.", "answer_choice": "A"}
